scenes.location: BEACH AT MALO LES BAINS CONTINUOUS
characters: AND FRENCH ARMIES TO THE SEA.
FISHERMEN, MERCHANT NAVY SAILORS, NAVAL OFFICERS, CIVILIA
TRAPPED AT DUNKIRK, THEY AWAIT THEIR
HITS THE WATER WITH A JOLT AND A TEARING SOUND-
THEY PULL AWAY FROM THE DISAPPEARING SHIP WITH THE STRENG
HE DIVES DOWN UNDER THE RANGE OF THE REAR TURRET-
TOMMY AND ALEX BURST FREE OF THE DOOR AS IT SINKS BENEATH
THE DIM LIGHT OF THE OPEN DOOR BECOMES A BEACON-
WITH HIS FISTS- INSTINCT TAKING OVER- NO MORE THOUGHT, NO
SMASH- SOMETHING CRACKS INTO THE CANOPY RIGHT ABOVE HIS H
OPENS UP ON HIM- TRACER FIRE LIGHTING UP ALL AROUND HIM-
THE ENEMY HAVE DRIVEN THE BRITISH
HIMSELF THROUGH- PUSHING OFF HIS SEAT-
THE LIGHTS GO OUT- COMPLETE DARKNESS...
ANYONE STANDING IS THROWN OFF THEIR FEET-
A BURST OF MACHINE GUN FIRE OPENS A NEW GROUP OF HOLES BE
YACHTS, PADDLE STEAMERS, FISHING TRAWLERS, DAY SAILERS,
HIS INSTINCT TO BREATH PUSHES HIM UP INTO THE FLAMES WHER
THE SURFACE OF THE WATER CATCHES FIRE- SPREADING ACROSS T
A BLAST THAT MOVES EVERY BOLT OF THE DESTROYER-
CREW, NAVAL CREW, NURSES, RETIRED SAILORS...
"LOCAL BOY, GEORGE MILLS, JUST 17, HERO AT DUNKIRK"
TOMMY AND ALEX CLAW THEIR WAY UP THE STEPS AS THE ENTIRE
COLLINS THRASHED AGAINST HIS BELTS FORWARD/BACK/LEFT/RIGH
THE MEN IN THE WATER BETWEEN THE TRAWLER AND THE DESTROYE
MORE PLAN- BANGING, BANGING- WATER RISING OVER HIS EARS-
MACHINE GUN FIRE STRAFES THE HULL- THE MEN DUCK BELOW THE
DEAFENING- HE HOLDS HIS EARS WITH HIS HANDS-
THE STUKA IS STRAFED WITH FIRE AS SPITFIRE1 FLASHES PAST-
SOUND OF MEN SCREAMING BARELY AUDIBLE OVER THE SOUND OF
A VAST PLUME OF FIRE EXPLODES UP AND OUT OF THE FUNNEL- T
MEN SCREAM AS THE IRON PLATES OF THE WALLS BUCKLE- A GLIM
THE ROW BOATS PULL AWAY, HARD-

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: Paper. Falling like snow. Six young, filthy Tommys raise their heads along a deserted street, checking rubbish bin windows... One crouches to check a coiled garden hose. He tries the tap- nothing...

dialogues.speaker: AND FRENCH ARMIES TO THE SEA.
dialogues.text: One TOMMY plucks paper from the air... propaganda leaflet showing their position... "YOU ARE SURROUNDED"...

dialogues.speaker: FATE.
dialogues.text: He wads the leaflets up, crouches, drops his trousers... Tommy with the hose carefully lifts each side...

dialogues.speaker: HOPING FOR DELIVERANCE.
dialogues.text: He gets a tiny DRIBBLE of water which he licks from the n

dialogues.speaker: FOR A MIRACLE.
dialogues.text: BLAMBLAMBLAM!- Tommy JOLTS, grabs his trousers- all six R away from us, towards a FENCE twenty yards away- one by o FIVE are SHOT DOWN- the survivor CLIMBS the fence- Gunfire BURSTS through the fence, TEN FEET AWAY- Tommy tries to RELOAD his rifle- fingers STRUGGLING with Magazine, training forgotten- Gunfire SPLINTERS the fence, FIVE FEET AWAY- Tommy THRUSTS his index finger into the breach of his rif AGAIN AND AGAIN, scraping skin- a round JUMPS into the ch

dialogues.speaker: GUNFIRE THREE FEET AWAY-
dialogues.text: Tommy tries once, twice- slides the bolt FORWARD- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GUNFIRE RIGHT NEXT TO HIM-
dialogues.text: Tommy SPINS AROUND, FIRES BLIND until empty, SCRAMBLES ou the back- He RACES down NARROW DUNKIRK STREETS. BREATHING. Kit JANGLING... building after building... he rounds a corner BLAM! Bullets hit dirt and bricks near him- the street ah is barricaded, manned by FRENCH TROOPS-

dialogues.speaker: ANGLAIS
dialogues.text: The French stop firing and wave him through. He SCRAMBLES over their sandbag barricade, taking in thei dirty, frightened faces as he passes... A FRENCH SOLDIER grabs him-

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Allez, Anglais. Tommy's mouth opens at the man's BITTERNESS. FRENCH SOLDIER (contempt) (CONT'D) Bon voyage. He SHOVES Tommy down the street behind their protection. GUNFIRE behind- Tommy TAKES OFF AGAIN- HURTLING down the dark street, heading towards the BLAZING LIGHT of -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LONGEST, WIDEST BEACH he's ever seen, sunlight DAZZLI off the water- Endless dark FENCES snaking across the sand and out into water - Tommy SQUINTS- not fences- lines of MEN- HUNDREDS OF THOUSANDS OF MEN... Tommy looks around, clutching his stomach. He CLAMBERS ov a dune, FEVERISHLY undoing his belt, dropping trousers an SQUATTING before he realizes- He's not alone- Another soldier, British army shirt undone, sweating with the labour of BURYING A BODY. This is GIBSON. The other man notices Tommy, but barely pauses. Tommy finishes, pulls up his trousers and moves towards him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy helps scoop sand over the body. Tommy notices the corpse's STOCKINGED FEET, then watches Gibson stoop to TIE HIS BOOTS... Gibson looks up at him. Tommy shrugs, gestures for Gibson water can. Gibson hands it over and Tommy takes a SWIG, carefully CATCHING drops in his hand, then LICKING them o his palm. Tommy leaves Gibson buttoning his shirt and heads back on the beach. There are DESTROYERS out on the water, too far to reach. Tommy wanders down to join one of the long, snaking lines which extends into the sea, soldiers up to their CHESTS i water, WAITING PATIENTLY FOR SHIPS WHICH DO NOT MOVE. The man at the back turns to Tommy, unwelcoming. Points a his own insignia.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Grenadiers, Mate. Tommy moves off. Looks around at other impossibly long li At the unattainable ships. Futile. A line of STRETCHER BEARERS comes past, carrying wounded along the beach towards the harbour... Looking where they're headed, Tommy sees a LONG, NARROW BREAKWATER extending out into the sea, packed with soldie A HOSPITAL SHIP at the end of it. This breakwater extends a kilometer into the sea. It is called THE MOLE. Super title:

dialogues.speaker: THE MOLE
dialogues.text: one week Tommy becomes aware of the sound of DISTANT AIRCRAFT. Soldiers peer up into the sky...

dialogues.speaker: DIVE BOMBERS
dialogues.text: Tommy spots the distinctive KINKED WINGS of the notorious STUKA DIVE BOMBER- its NIGHTMARISH HOWL RISING as it pick up speed, DIVING at the beach... The lines of men INSTANTLY VANISH- soldiers SCATTERING ba to the dunes, BURROWING into the sand... the first BOMBS lift sand into the air- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stretcher bearers put down their loads, lying across them, protecting them as the area is HAMMERED... The first STUKA pulls out of its dive, revealing TWO MORE STUKAS DIVING- there are NINE MORE about to follow... Tommy sees a soldier lying ON HIS BACK, RIFLE AIMED AT TH SKY, FIRING DEFIANTLY, DESPERATELY at the attacking plane the ground around him LIFTS into the air with the second wave of bombs. Tommy buries his face in the sand as the bombs BLAST AND

dialogues.speaker: BLAST AND BLAST-
dialogues.text: The explosions stop. Tommy lifts his head. BOOM- ANOTHER WAVE OF BOMBS EXPLODES IN SERIES UP THE BEACH. Then, fina quiet. Tommy rises... The stretcher bearers, back on their feet, lift their bur (four bearers per stretcher, one at each corner) Several stretchers are left behind on the sand. Soldiers on the beach watch in despair as one of the DESTROYERS is slipping below the water, smoke billowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LANKY YOUTH runs down to the masts of the crowded harbo He RACES along the wooden dock, jumping over ropes as he rushes to a large yacht, the MOONSTONE.

dialogues.speaker: THE SEA
dialogues.text: one day The Youth, GEORGE (17), leaps from the dock into the well Two NAVAL OFFICERS emerge from the cabin, pushing past. George watches them go, confused... Mr.Dawson (50's, civilian dress) hands George a stack of china plates and ducks back inside. A second young man, PETER (19), emerges, carrying boxes-

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Navy's requisitioned her- there's some men across the channel, at Dunkirk, need taking off. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (points at dock) They told us to strip her and load those life jackets. George looks along at the dock. At a pile of HUNDREDS of life jackets. George looks at Peter. Surprised.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Some men?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Navy'll be back in an hour. My dad wants to be ready before then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING through BILLOWY PEAKS, three sleek, beautiful SPIT streak into frame. Elegant. In confident formation.

dialogues.speaker: THE AIR
dialogues.text: one hour

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pilot, FARRIER, has a light touch on the controls. He checks his left and right, scanning the skies.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE ON RADIO
dialogues.text: Check fuel, Fortis 1 and 2. Farrier reaches forward to his FUEL GAUGE, pushes the but beside it- the needle SHOOTS up to 3/4 FULL.

dialogues.speaker: FARRIER
dialogues.text: 70 gallons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pilot, COLLINS, checks his fuel gauge-

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: 68 gallons, Fortis Leader. FORTIS LEADER (over radio) Stay down at 500ft to leave fuel for 40 minutes fighting time over Dunkirk.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Understood. Vector 128, angels point five.  10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier checks his chart.

dialogues.speaker: FORTIS LEADER
dialogues.text: Keep an eye on that gauge, even when it gets lively- save enough to get back. With a glance at his fuel gauge, Farrier pulls on the sti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three planes bank left in perfect harmony as we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy looks down at several patients on stretchers left behind, bearers dead or disappeared... ONE OF THEM GROANS. STILL ALIVE. Tommy looks around- Gibson is there. They GRAB the stretcher and HUSTLE down the beach towards the mole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WARRANT OFFICER tries to keep order as men line up to s the shuffle out along the 8 FOOT WIDE CONCRETE MOLE. The LINE OF STRETCHER BEARERS approaches... From the base all you can see is the the backs of helmete heads queuing out onto the narrow breakwater The Warrant Officer sees the stretchers, waves them past-

dialogues.speaker: WARRANT OFFICER
dialogues.text: Along the mole. All the way, she's leaving-

dialogues.speaker: WARRANT OFFICER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's it- (he turns)

dialogues.speaker: MAKE WAY
dialogues.text: The stretcher bearers squeeze past...  11 12 13 14 15

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy and Gibson hear the SHIP'S WHISTLE. They start RUNN with the stretcher, heading for the base of the mole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Warrant Officer addresses a group of FRENCH SOLDIERS-

dialogues.speaker: HAVE YOUR OWN SHIPS
dialogues.text: Tommy and Gibson arrive, panting. The Warrant Officer loo at them. The SHIP'S WHISTLE- the Warrant Officer points u

dialogues.speaker: WARRANT OFFICER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's two minutes- you've missed it. He turns back to ARGUING with the French... Tommy PUSHES forward with the stretcher- soldiers try to him through on the narrow mole- The Warrant Officer, seeing Tommy, just shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stretchers are loaded up the gangplank onto the deck of t ship, supervised by a Petty Officer. He checks his watch, then looks along the mole at the remaining stretchers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy weaves along the mole, squeezing past the mass of t jamming the breakwater... Tommy leans out over the edge where the RAIL IS MISSING, 20ft drop to the churning water... Gibson follows, echoing Tommy's route and footing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last of the line of stretchers is carefully, awkwardl raised up from the mole onto the deck of the ship. The Pe Officer speaks urgently to the last stretcher bearer.

dialogues.speaker: PETTY OFFICER
dialogues.text: Last? The Stretcher Bearer NODS, too breathless to speak, then follows his colleagues BACK DOWN OFF THE SHIP- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: An EXPLOSION hits the water nearby- Everyone hits the deck as shells IMPACT the water

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy is PULLED UP SHORT as Gibson STUMBLES- A 109 STRAFES the length of the mole with gunfire- soldie hit the deck, several are HIT... Gibson STRUGGLES up-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and George RUSH things off the boat- then start loa the orange life preservers Mr.Dawson looks up from his ch to see NAVAL OFFICERS AND CREW coming along the harbor, assigning crew members to boats... Peter follows his gaze-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter bursts into the cabin, stacking life vests-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pile of life vests on the dock SHRINKS... Mr.Dawson watches the Naval men coming closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier lightly brushes his fingers over the dashboard. COLLINS (over radio) Dunkirk's so far, why can't they load at Calais? Farrier looks over at his wing mate, COLLINS (Fortis 2) FORTIS LEADER (over radio) The enemy had something to say about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins SCANS the skies above...

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Down here we're sitting ducks. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FORTIS LEADER (over radio) Keep ‘em peeled. They'll come out of the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier looks around into the blinding sun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Petty Officer barks orders at the crew-

dialogues.speaker: PETTY OFFICER
dialogues.text: Man the bow line! Ready on the stern! Troops stuck down on the mole below look resentfully at t ship preparing to depart. One soldier calls up-

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Any more room? The Petty Officer GLARES down at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy breaks through a tight crowd of soldiers and STOPS. In front of him is a jagged chasm. One NARROW PLANK laid across it. The drop is fifteen feet to rocks and concrete below- The SHIP WHISTLE SOUNDS- Tommy stares-

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Take a run at it! Tommy glances at the soldier who spoke. Looks back at Gib

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: One, two, three! Tommy BOLTS across, pure concentration, the plank BOWING and BOUNCING as he crosses the middle, Gibson following- Tommy's foot SLIPS- he almost goes over, rights himself - Helpful arms GRAB them as they hit the other side, a coup of CHEERS from the crowd- Tommy PLOUGHS ON-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy passes the stretcher bearers coming back down the m one of them moves to help but Tommy SHAKES his head, push past... The Petty Officer gestures at his men to pull the gangpla (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PULL THE GANGPLANKS
dialogues.text: Tommy and Gibson arrive at the end of the mole-

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Oi! A gangplank is shoved back down- They STRUGGLE up it with the stretcher... When they make it to the deck they practically drop their burden, GASPING for breath. Orderlies takes the stretcher below. Tommy and Gibson look around for a place to perch, catchi their breaths...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr.Dawson sees the Naval Officers stepping onto their doc

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: Ready on the stern line. George HOPS onto the dock, unties the stern line. STOPS. Looks at the approaching Officers. Then back to Mr.Dawson

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Aren't you waiting for the navy? Mr.Dawson starts the engine. Peter jumps down onto the bo with the bow rope...

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: They've asked for the Moonstone, they'll have her. With her Captain.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: And his son. The boat moves off- Peter looks to catch the line from Ge

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks for the help, George. Who, instead, JUMPS onto the stern, to Peter's surprise.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know where we're going?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: France. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: Into war, George.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I'll be useful, sir. Mr.Dawson looks at George. Pushes the throttle forward an they motor out of the harbour into the English Channel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins spots something-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier SPOTS the ME109 COMING OUT OF THE SUN-

dialogues.speaker: FARRIER
dialogues.text: Bandit- eight o'clock. FORTIS LEADER (over radio) Break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three Spitfires dart away from each other- the German plane takes the left one (Collins), HURTLING down-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins dives, ROLLING, glancing back-

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: He's on me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier banks around, lining up on Collins' pursuer-

dialogues.speaker: FARRIER
dialogues.text: And I'm on him-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy and Gibson shuffle around the deck, looking for a s to settle... The Able Seaman manning the gangplank calls over-

dialogues.speaker: ABLE SEAMEN
dialogues.text: You two, get a shift on! Tommy reluctantly follows Gibson onto the plank. 26 27 28 29 30 31 32  33 34 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he shuffles down the gangplank he looks over at the THOUSANDS queuing on the mole... A SECOND LIEUTENANT on the mole WAVES Tommy along-

dialogues.speaker: SECOND LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: Off you go! Back up the line! As Tommy steps off the plank he hears a noise- Gibson, finger to his lips, "shush", is crouched in the crisscross structure below the mole where he can't be see by the officers on top. He beckons Tommy to join him..

dialogues.speaker: PETTY OFFICER
dialogues.text: That last barrage damaged the rudder The Second Lieutenant TURNS to the Petty Officer- Tommy s down beside Gibson-

dialogues.speaker: SECOND LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: Tie up again while we try to fix it. They settle in on the beams just above the water line...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr.Dawson comes to the back of the well, fits the TILLER, steer from outside. Peter at his side. George, on the bow looks across at several Naval Vessels on the same course. Suddenly he SPOTS a BOMBER overhead-

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Mr .Dawson! Mr.Dawson's eyes don't leave his course-

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: One of ours, George. George looks up as the plane, a Blenheim bomber passes ov Looking down to his left- a FISHING TRAWLER bobbing along Further back down the convoy his sees a THAMES PADDLE STE A Destroyer approaches from the opposite direction. As Ge PEERS, he starts to make out shapes of men on the decks. The Destroyer passes close enough that George can see tha the boat is PACKED with soldiers. Weary, bedraggled, dispirited soldiers. George STARES at the haunted faces. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As the Moonstone rides over the WAKE of the Destroyer, an OMINOUS BOOM REVERBERATES in the distance. Too sudden for thunder, the boom multiplies into a distant barrage... Mr.Dawson comes forwards, drawn by the sound. He stares a the horizon- distant BLACK SMOKE precisely where they're headed. More BOOMS. Mr.Dawson looks at George. Who is SCARED. He puts his hand on his shoulder. Nods reassuring

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier concentrates, trying to angle his plane at the ta of the ME 109 ahead... but the German plane keeps pulling out of his sights, turning right, pulling g's, rolling...

dialogues.speaker: FARRIER
dialogues.text: On my mark- draw him left, Fortis 2... 3,2,1, mark-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins pulls hard left, rolling up and left as TRACER FI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier watches the ME 109 cut left to follow Collins- he pushes the button on his stick to STRAFE the plane with h cannons... SMOKE starts trailing from the German plane-

dialogues.speaker: FARRIER
dialogues.text: Clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ME 109 trails heavy smoke as it tips towards the wate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins straightens out- tries to look back-

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Is he down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier watches the ME 109 SMASH into the water, breaking in a fiery mess-

dialogues.speaker: FARRIER
dialogues.text: Down for the count- TRACER FIRE SMASHES into Farrier's plane, SPARKING inside and out- Farrier banks HARD RIGHT as a second 109 STREAKS away- he straightens up- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FARRIER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fortis leader, one bandit down... (nothing) Fortis Leader, do you read? Nothing. Farrier looks around- spots a Spitfire-

dialogues.speaker: FARRIER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fortis 2, I have you to port- no eyes on Fortis leader. Over. COLLINS (over radio) Understood, Fortis 1. Orbit for a look... Farrier looks all around as he pulls right on the stick..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eerie quiet. Tommy and Gibson sit in the structure, UNSEEN, listening. COMMANDER BOLTON checks progress on board the hospital sh

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: How long, Lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: We need to run a new cable, sir. They're scrambling. Commander Bolton turns to Colonel Winnant, the army representative.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: Colonel, you're going to have to decide how many more wounded to evacuate... one stretcher takes the space of seven standing men. Colonel Winnant takes this in. Tommy crouches lower as he sees a LAUNCH approach... A HIGH RANKING OFFICER is helped up the ladder onto the m COMMANDER BOLTON (salutes) (CONT'D) Rear Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: REAR ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Commander . (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: REAR ADMIRAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Colonel Winnant ) At ease, Colonel. How's the perimeter? Colonel Winnant GESTURES towards the smoke-shrouded town-

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: Shrinking every day. But between our rear guard and the French... we're holding the line. And the enemy tanks've stopped.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: Waste precious tanks, when you can pick us off from the air, like fish in a barrel?

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: How long does London expect the army to hold out before we make terms? The Rear Admiral looks sharply at the idea.

dialogues.speaker: REAR ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Make terms? They're not stopping here. We need to get our army back. The Rear Admiral points across the dark water...

dialogues.speaker: REAR ADMIRAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Britain's next. Then the world. Commander Bolton puts his field glasses to his face-

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: Christ, you can almost see it from here...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: Home. (turns to the town) What about the French?

dialogues.speaker: REAR ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Publicly, Churchill's told them "Bras Dessous" (off look) Arm in arm. Leaving together (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: And privately?

dialogues.speaker: REAR ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: We need our army back.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: How many men are they talking about?

dialogues.speaker: REAR ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Churchill wants 30,000. Ramsay's hoping we can give him 45. Commander Bolton looks out at the mass of humanity.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: There are 400 thousand men on this beach, sir. Down below, Tommy takes this in. Every man for himself.

dialogues.speaker: REAR ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: We'll just have to do our best. Bolton straightens up.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: Right, this mole stays open at all costs. Bolton points at the FUNNEL and MASTS of SUNKEN SHIPS-

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're in range of artillery from the west- anything else sinks out here the mole's blocked and we're stuffed.

dialogues.speaker: REAR ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Can't we load from the beaches?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: Better than standing out here when the dive bombers come.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: Impossible. The Rear Admiral looks at the lines of men on the beaches

dialogues.speaker: REAR ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Too shallow.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: Anything drafting more than three feet can't get near. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We don't have enough small boats to ferry men out to the destroyers. The Rear Admiral nods.

dialogues.speaker: REAR ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: The mole it is, then, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr.Dawson is on the bow, peering ahead. The distant smoke is closer, small shapes in the sky move above distant shi accompanied by thunderous booms... Much nearer: a shape. A WRECK. Upside down. Mr.Dawson moves quickly down the yacht to the well and ta the helm, throttling back. He gestures for Peter to head the bow. The Moonstone approaches the wreck. BODIES surround the overturned hull. Crouched on the hull- a SOLDIER. Mr.Dawson REVERSES the screw, slowing to a crawl. Peter stares out at the SHIVERING SOLDIER.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Can you swim it? The Shivering Soldier STARES back at Peter. Peter looks back at Mr.Dawson-

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you get closer? Mr.Dawson looks down the side of the boat, considers.

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: Can't risk it! Mr.Dawson turns to George.

dialogues.speaker: MR.DAWSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take Peter a line. George grabs a coiled rope and heads up to the bow. Peter takes the rope from George-

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I'll throw you a line! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The shivering soldier looks up at him, blank. Peter tosse the line. It hits the water several feet in front of the soldier who STARES at it. Peter gathers the line, then TOSSES it again- The shivering soldier SPRINGS for it, GRABBING it and HAN ON as Peter and George reel him in, pulling him around to the stern ladder. He is too exhausted to make it up the ladder, so they gra his shirt, pulling him into the well. George grabs a blanket and puts it around the soldier's shoulders. Mr.Dawson glances at the Soldier, then reverses from the wreck the way he came in, and steers wide around the visi portion of the wreck Once the water ahead is open, Mr.Dawson speeds up, headin again for the dark smoke of Dunkirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Spitfires arc around the wreckage of the ME 109..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier SPOTS something-

dialogues.speaker: FARRIER
dialogues.text: Wreckage below. He heads low over the wreckage... COLLINS (over radio) More of the 109? Farrier banks, looking down- spots a half submerged tail- clearly RAF-

dialogues.speaker: FARRIER
dialogues.text: No, it's Fortis Leader, over.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Do you think he got out?

dialogues.speaker: FARRIER
dialogues.text: Didn't see a ‘chute. Farrier straightens up. Considers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FARRIER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Record his position, then set heading 128, height... 1,000, over.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Vector 128, angels 1. Understood. Farrier reaches forward, pushes the button by his fuel gauge... NOTHING. The glass is CRACKED. He TAPS it with his glove. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: FARRIER
dialogues.text: Fortis 2, what's your fuel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins checks his gauge.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Fifty gallons, over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier takes this down with a grease pencil...

dialogues.speaker: FARRIER
dialogues.text: Keep letting me know- my gauge took a knock back there, over

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Should you turn back? Farrier methodically checks his other gauges and switches checks the responsiveness of rudder, aerilons...

dialogues.speaker: FARRIER
dialogues.text: I'm confident it's just the gauge. Farrier glances at his pencil mark, sets the BEZEL on his watch. He TAPS his gauge one more time. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bolton watches the Rear Admiral motor away in his launch- the engine noise fading to be replaced by- A familiar, dreaded sound is building. STUKAS. The men on the mole look up at the sky. From high above we see how trapped and exposed this line men stretching a kilometer into the sea really is. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Restless, the soldiers look behind and in front. There's simply nowhere to go. The awful whine builds. Then change pitch as the bombers go into their DIVE. BOOMBOOMBOOMBOOMBOOM! The bombs impact the sea either sid of the mole- soldiers crouch as low as they can- The onslaught is ENDLESS, TERRIBLE and INESCAPABLE... BOOM! A direct hit to the Hospital Ship- The Stukas have gone. Screams and shouts- people start JUMPING OVER THE SIDE of the HOSPITAL SHIP onto the mole...

dialogues.speaker: VOICES
dialogues.text: She's going down! SHE'S GOING UNDER! g g Commander Bolton shouts at the men manning the lines-

dialogues.speaker: CUT HER LOOSE
dialogues.text: The crew are jumping off the side, the burning ship is SI

dialogues.speaker: SUB-LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: What about the wounded?

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: Cut her loose, and push her off! We can't let her sink at the mole! The men cast her off and PUSH her off- Crew members and orderlies LEAP from the deck into the wa The bow of the BLAZING, SINKING ship drifts away from the mole... Tommy and Gibson pull soldiers up onto the beams of the mole... As the bow comes around, the stern SCRAPES along the wood pilings, SPLINTERING them in its path- A FLAILING SOLDIER is in its path, trying to swim free- The STEEL HULK is about to CRUSH HIM- Tommy GRABS him by the shoulders and YANKS with all his m pulling him clear just as the hull GRINDS against the woo Tommy looks down on the breathless, wet soldier. The wet Soldier focuses on Tommy. THIS IS ALEX. He nods thanks. Tommy nods back. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Commander Bolton WATCHES the ship slip down into the wave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr.Dawson is back at the helm. The Shivering Soldier sits in the well, blanket over his shoulders. Staring at the deck. George watches him, then leans forward-

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Come below- it's out of the wind. The Shivering Soldier glances at the companionway. Shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Really- it's warmer. George reaches out for the Shivering Soldier's arm- who S it away-

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: Leave him, George. George looks up at the Commander

dialogues.speaker: MR.DAWSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He feels safer on deck. You would too if you'd been bombed-

dialogues.speaker: SHIVERING SOLDIER
dialogues.text: U-boat. It was a U-boat.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Get him some tea, George. George darts downstairs. Useful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Spitfires head towards the massive BLACK SMOKE ha over the distant port of Dunkirk. There are many different ships and boats of all sizes in water in front of them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins pushes the button to check the fuel gauge-

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: 40 gallons, Fortis 1. over.  51 52 53 54 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier instinctively looks at his gauge. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: FARRIER
dialogues.text: 40 gallons, understood. Farrier pulls out a grease pencil and notes fuel and time

dialogues.speaker: FARRIER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're about five minutes out- climb to 2,000. COLLINS (over radio) That's more fuel.

dialogues.speaker: FARRIER
dialogues.text: I don't want to get jumped again. Get some altitude, dive down on the bastards. Over. COLLINS (over radio) Understood. Angels two, over Farrier pulls back on the stick-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Spitfires RISE gloriously into higher air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Bolton looks over at the wet soldiers clinging the understructure of the mole.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Right, Highlanders. Let's find you another ship. The wet soldiers pull themselves to their feet... Tommy, watched by Alex, SLIPS into the water, then pulls himself out, dripping. Gibson follows suit. Alex LAUGHS a them... then helps them push into the group... They follow the wet soldiers up onto the mole, where Bolt men shepherd them onto a LAUNCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy and Gibson make themselves inconspicuous amongst th Highlanders, eyes down. As the launch pulls away from the mole, Tommy glances bac at the men lining the breakwater (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: he launch motors out of the harbour. t approaches a DESTROYER, its sheer iron side TOWERING ab he launch, as it BOBS up and down alongside. 1

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: t CARGO NETS are dropped over the side, and the men start t step up onto the rail of the BOBBING ship, waiting for th RHYTHMIC movement towards the iron wall- GRABBING at the rope mesh, STRUGGLING to pull themselves up. ommy steps up to the railing, next to an EXHAUSTED soldie ho can barely lift himself up- Tommy grabs his shoulder t teady him on the rail as the launch BOUNCES off the iron all of the destroyer- he exhausted soldier has not got his feet into the nettin e slips lower... he gap between the launch and the destroyer shrinks to

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: wi s Wi They both grab at the net, Tommy climbing up- 1 h

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: nothing-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier's legs are CRUSHED between the two oblivious craft- He SCREAMS- hands PULL him up as the craft separate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men collapse onto the deck in exhausted piles. SAILOR and NURSES urge them to move below decks.

dialogues.speaker: SAILOR
dialogues.text: Down below. Come on, mate- Tommy follows Alex and his mates to a doorway at the head the stairs down below. A NURSE is standing there.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Come on, boys. There's a nice cup of tea for you down there. This way, come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy starts down the stairs- Gibson has stopped at the t looking down into the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Come on, down you go- Gibson, shaking his head, steps back Alex sees this- turns to follow Tommy into the crowd in t hold. They are handed a cup of tea each and a hunk of bre  24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out on deck, Gibson sits by the companionway in the gathe dark as the ship gets underway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down below, Tommy and Alex eat and drink hungrily and gratefully. Between bites, Alex gestures to the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What's wrong with your friend? Tommy WATCHES THE DOOR TO THE HOLD CLOSE. Takes another bite. Uneasy. Looks around the hold, PACKED LIKE THE TUBE AT RUSH HOUR.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Looking for a quick way out. In case we go down. Tommy and Alex edge through the crowd towards the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George hands the Shivering Soldier a steaming mug of tea. The BOOMS start reverberating again. The Shivering Soldier glances up. REALIZES SOMETHING...

dialogues.speaker: SHIVERING SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: Dunkirk.

dialogues.speaker: SHIVERING SOLDIER
dialogues.text: No, we're going to England!

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: We have to go to Dunkirk first.

dialogues.speaker: I'M NOT GOING BACK
dialogues.text: Peter watches from the companionway. The Shivering Soldie throws his arm out at the dark cloud on the horizon-

dialogues.speaker: SHIVERING SOLDIER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look at it! We go there we'll die! Mr.Dawson looks at the Shivering Soldier. Calm. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: I see your point, son. Take your tea below and warm up while we plot a course. The Shivering Soldier considers this. Then takes his blan and heads down the companionway. Peter helps him down bel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter opens the door to the forepeak and sits the Shiveri Soldier down on a narrow bunk

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I'll get you some more tea. Peter shuts the door. Looks at the bolt. Considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George looks up at the Commander. Addresses him with the tone of a child trying to speak like a grown up...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Is he a coward? Mr.Dawson looks sharply at George.

dialogues.speaker: MR.DAWSON
dialogues.text: He's shell-shocked, George. He's not himself. He may never be himself again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter hands the Shivering Soldier a cup of tea. The Shive Soldier accepts it wordlessly. Staring in front of him. Peter closes the forepeak door. Pauses. Peter gently slides the bolt, LOCKING THE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier looks down at the mass of ships and boats passing each other- there is the minesweeper, CASTOR, every inch her deck covered with troops- COLLINS (over radio) Heinkel, 11 @'clock, lining up to drop her load on that minesweeper - Farrier's head SNAPS around- spots the German bomber -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins PEERS down- scanning around the Heinkel BOMBER fo its fighter escort... SPOTS-

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: 109's- off her starboard- FARRIER (over radio) I'm on the bomber. Collins pushes forward into a DIVE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spitfire 2 DIVES at the German fighters, cannons BLASTING Spitfire 1 DIVES at the German bomber, cannons BLASTING..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier has the Heinkel in his sights, bucking and weavin as his spitfire SLICES down through turbulent air... he p the button on the stick which control his guns... He ROLLS away from the Heinkel as he dives beneath it, ta his finger off the trigger, fighting the g's with his nec as he pulls out of the dive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins fires at one of the 109's until he sees SMOKE tra he DIVES between the German planes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier SCANS his surroundings as he tries to orient hims relative to the Heinkel... Finding it, he pulls the stick, lining up for another run it, this time from below... The bomber is in his sights- he fires his guns... He flashes past- dangerously close to its top turret whic HURLS TRACER BULLETS at him- he sees SPARKING on the hull the bomber -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming around- starting to climb- Collins sees the Heinke VEER OFF COURSE, heading away from the minesweeper -

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: She's turning- you must've damaged her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FARRIER (over radio) Where's the escort?

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: I got one of- BLAMBLAMBLAM!!! Cannon fire RIPS into Spitfire 2- Collins YANKS the stick but it's too late... flames leap from the fuselage...

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm going down. FARRIER (over radio) I'm on him- bail out. Collins checks his parachute, opens the canopy, the wind HOWLS inside the cockpit- he surveys the water below- SLIDES his canopy shut again.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: The swell looks good, I'm ditching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MUNCHING and SLURPING of starving soldiers. The ENGINES kick into gear as the destroyer starts to mov A CHEER goes up around the hundreds of men in the hold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up on deck, Gibson watches several ROW BOATS heading towa them- hearing the engines, they starts SHOUTING-

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICES
dialogues.text: Wait! Wait for us! Gibson spots white water on the black sea- a wake-

dialogues.speaker: TORPEDO
dialogues.text: An EXPLOSION LIFTS WATER at the side of the ship-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cheering STOPS- BOOOOOMS SHUDDER the suddenly FRAGILE iron walls of the hold- MASSIVE PERCUSSIONS OF WOBBLING M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George hears planes behind them- he looks up- THREE SPITFIRES IN CONFIDENT FORMATION SWEEP OVERHEAD... Mr.Dawson keeps his eyes on the black smoke ahead of them

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: Spitfires, George. Greatest plane ever built. George smiles. Then looks quizzical-

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You didn't even look.

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: Rolls Royce Merlin engines. Sweetest sound you could hear out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter is folding a chart. A clicking sound catches his attention... the handle of the forepeak door is being rat from the other side. Peter FREEZES, uncertain what to do. BANG- the rattles become BANGS-

dialogues.speaker: SHIVERING SOLDIER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello?! Anyone there?! Peter puts the chart down, takes a step towards the door-

dialogues.speaker: OPEN UP, DAMMIT
dialogues.text: Peter freezes. Turns back to the companionway-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter pokes his head out- Mr.Dawson looks at him, quizzic

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: He wants to come out- The banging and SHOUTING of the Shivering Soldier continu

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: What did you do? Lock him in? Peter is at a loss-

dialogues.speaker: MR.DAWSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let him out, for God's sake!  83 84 85 86 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter comes down the companionway, reluctantly approachin the BANGING, RATTLING DOOR... THE BANGING STOPS... Peter reaches up to the bolt, BRACES, gently SLIDES it ba Opens the door- the forepeak is EMPTY... Peter rushes in spots the open forward hatch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr.Dawson leans down to try and see in the cabin-

dialogues.speaker: SHIVERING SOLDIER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You haven't turned around! Mr.Dawson turns calmly to the Shivering Soldier

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: No. We have a job to do.

dialogues.speaker: SHIVERING SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Job? This is a pleasure yacht! You're weekend sailors, not the bloody navy-! A man your age-

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: Men my age dictate this war. Why are we allowed to send our children to fight it?

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: There won't be any home if we allow this slaughter across the channel. There's no hiding from this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier chases the 109 as it circles around on Collins...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins glances out at his burning wing- Checks his altimeter- Checks his canopy is locked in the half-open position- LOWER...  87 88 89 90 91 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier fires at the 109, chasing him off-

dialogues.speaker: FARRIER
dialogues.text: He's turned tail, I'm after him-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins checks his belts are tight- Checks the release pin on his harness-

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Good luck. Watch your fuel... (reads) Fifteen gallons. Checks his Mae West, puffing into the inflating tube- LOWER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier grease pencils the reading on the chart-

dialogues.speaker: FARRIER
dialogues.text: Fifteen gallons, understood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARRIER (over radio) ...best of luck, Collins. Collins checks wind direction- Checks wave direction on the surface of the water- LOWER... Turns, lining up along the the waves as he descends... LOWER... The water rushes by BLINDINGLY FAST...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier watches Spitfire 2 CARVE gracefully across the wa before coming to a stop, floating. Farrier spots a CIVILIAN YACHT heading for Collins... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He sees Collins' hand stick out of the canopy, WAVING... TIPS HIS WINGS at Collins- turns away, looks ahead, chasi the 109 towards Dunkirk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy and Alex, life jackets on, swim on the swell, bodie and burning wreckage all around. Fuel BURNING on the surf of the water. Tommy and Alex pull for an OVERLOADED row boat. Tommy GRA the side, tries to climb- he's PUSHED OFF by the men insi

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE
dialogues.text: Piss off- it's too crowded! Alex is GRABBING at the rail as well-

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You can't leave us! Make some room-

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You men, leave off. You'll capsize the boat- it's gone over twice on the way out here... Tommy looks at the Soldier. It is the Shivering Soldier NOT YET SHIVERING. IN FULL CONTROL OF HIS FACULTIES.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have to stay calm. There are plenty of boats.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Calm?! Wait till you get torpedoed, then tell us to be calm!

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: You have life jackets?

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE
dialogues.text: Yeah, they do.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Don't panic, the water's not too rough, or too cold. We're heading back to the beach-

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE
dialogues.text: Fuck off! Let's go to Dover Several voices join in. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: We can't make it across the channel on this, lads. We need to get back to the beach and wait for another ride. (gestures) It's not even half a mile. You men in the water float here, save your strength, we'll come back for you. The men start rowing. Gibson is in the back. Alex SPOTS him. Gibson quietly drops the rear painter (a small rope attac to the stern) into the black water Alex takes it, hands part of it to Tommy and they quietly drag behind the boat as it rows in to the shore... the me in the rear notice, but nobody says anything... As the dawn breaks, the small, packed boat pulls across t calm water to the vast, packed beach at Dunkirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shivering Soldier steps up to Mr.Dawson-

dialogues.speaker: SHIVERING SOLDIER
dialogues.text: What is it you think you can do out there?! On this thing?!

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: Not just us. The call went out- we won't be the only ones to answer

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: Did you have a gun?

dialogues.speaker: SHIVERING SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Course. A rifle. 303.

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: Did it help you against the dive bombers? Or the U-boats? The Shivering Soldier GLARES at Mr.Dawson.

dialogues.speaker: SHIVERING SOLDIER
dialogues.text: You're an old fool. And you're going to die if you don't turn around. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The BOOMS echo. Closer now.

dialogues.speaker: SHIVERING SOLDIER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're turning around, now! The Shivering Soldier steps towards Mr.Dawson. SCREAMING the top of his lungs-

dialogues.speaker: TURN IT AROUND
dialogues.text: Peter, hearing this, makes his way back from the bow- The Shivering Soldier GRABS the wheel- George GRABS his shoulder - The Shivering Soldier SMASHES HIS ELBOW into George's fac sending him flying BACKWARDS DOWN THE COMPANIONWAY - Peter PULLS the Shivering Soldier away from the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Calm it down, Mate. The Shivering Soldier looks at him, shocked. Confused. Peter calls down the companionway-

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: George? Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: George?! Nothing. The Shivering Soldier watches as Peter climbs do to find-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George, sprawled out at the foot of the steps, on his bac QUIETLY GROANING, BLEEDING from the back of the head. Pet grabs a life jacket and puts it behind George's head.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: It's okay. You're okay. It's okay. George blinks at Peter. Frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier chases the 109, gradually CLOSING... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Up ahead- a convoy of ships is gathered around the entran to the harbour... Farrier passes over a FISHING TRAWLER WITH A BLUE CABIN, covered with soldiers, strangely low in the water, WATER WASHING ACROSS ITS DECKS... He looks up ahead to the 109, just coming into range... He spots GERMAN PLANES in the distance, heading towards h he sights the 109... FIRES a short burst... NOTHING... HE REMEMBERS HIS FUEL GAUGE... -pointlessly pushes the button next to the cracked gauge. NO RESPONSE. Farrier checks his position on his chart. Checks the last fuel reading he grease-penciled... KNOWS HE SHOULD TURN A Farrier sights the 109, banking slightly to bring it acro his sights... Farrier FIRES- the 109 starts SMOKING, DROPPING- Farrier SPINS AROUND- TURNING AWAY from the approaching planes, HEADING FOR DOVER... FOR HOME. As he passes over the sinking blue trawler, he sees men jumping into the water, swimming for a DESTROYER nearby.. In his REAR VIEW MIRROR; the enemy planes approaching... Farrier looks at his cracked fuel gauge... THINKING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SURF has picked up since yesterday... Tommy, Gibson, Alex lie on the beach, sleeping as the lig comes up on a stormy day. In the distance, towards the dark smoke of Dunkirk, the l of men extend into the sea. Nearby, small groups of soldiers attempt to climb onto sm vessels- rowboats are being SWAMPED and OVERTURNED in the surf, overcrowded boats are GROUNDED on the sand-

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE
dialogues.text: Right. Three of you out, or the rest's stuck. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Soldiers give up their places. Some head back out of the surf. Some wade out past the break...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Winnant walks the beach, surveying. He approaches group of ENGINEERS driving TRUCKS onto the sand, taking t air out of their tires, laying duckboards on top...

dialogues.speaker: ENGINEER
dialogues.text: (brightly) A pier. When the water comes back in. Tide's turning, now. Colonel Winnant looks out at the churning water.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: How can you tell?

dialogues.speaker: ENGINEER
dialogues.text: (quietly) The bodies come back Colonel Winnant looks out at the water- men in line, ches deep, gently push floating bodies aside as they wash in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy BANGS a tin of vegetables on a rock. It springs a leak and he sucks the juice. Gibson holds out his hand. Tommy keeps sucking for a beat or two, then hands it over Tommy watches Vanquisher loading troops from the vast cro lining the mole. Despairing. Alex opens his eyes and sits up. Spots some HIGHLANDERS walking past, away from Dunkirk in loose formation...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hey! Highlanders! Tommy watches as Alex gets to his feet, heading over to h regimental comrades.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's that way?

dialogues.speaker: HIGHLANDER1
dialogues.text: (points) A boat. Alex follows his gesture to a FISHING TRAWLER WITH A BLUE CABIN, listing in the shallows a mile up the beach.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: She's grounded. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HIGHLANDER2
dialogues.text: Not when the tide comes in, she isn't. Tommy and Gibson are already on their feet. Alex nods at them as they follow the Highlanders down the beach toward the grounded trawler...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter goes down below to check on George. He checks the bleeding on the life jacket behind George's head.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: What'd you want to come along for George?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Sea cadet? You and Mr.Dawson? Best thing I ever done. Only thing I ever done. I told my dad I never done nothing at school. I told my dad I'd do something one day. Maybe get in the local paper.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: The Herald? Why?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Maybe teachers would see it. Make my school proud.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (laughs) Who cares what your bloody school thinks, George? George looks up at Peter, desperate.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Please! Please don't laugh at me! Peter looks at George, deciding how to respond.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I'm going to laugh at you, George- ‘cos you're being bloody silly. George is crying.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, stop it. I need you back up on deck. George keeps crying. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I can't. I can't see. Peter looks at him. Gets a blanket, puts it across George chest.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Get some rest. Peter gets up. Looks down at the softly weeping boy.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll need you as soon as you're able. George nods. Smiling through his tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter comes up on deck The Shivering Soldier, crouched in the well, STARES at hi Mr.Dawson is at the helm. Peter comes close. Speaking low

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: The blood won't stop. Should we turn back? Mr.Dawson looks back towards Britain. Then forward to Fra Thinking. Shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: Come too far. BOOM! Explosions nearby- The Shivering Soldier moves into a foetal position. Mr.Dawson and Peter look ahead to where PLUMES of water r seemingly in slow motion, amongst the ships up ahead- German BOMBERS drifting overhead, 109 fighters buzzing ar them... Mr.Dawson holds his course...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier flies, DISTRACTED, glancing from his broken fuel gauge to the switch for his reserve fuel tank...

dialogues.speaker: FARRIER
dialogues.text: Sod it. Farrier BANKS, COMING AROUND... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Farrier CLIMBS, trying to gain advantage for the coming encounter... lining up on the German planes threatening t Destroyer and the blue trawler...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Winnant makes his way towards the crowded mole. Stretchers of FRENCH TROOPS are brought down to the mole. PRIVATE comes out of the crowd, BREATHLESS.

dialogues.speaker: PRIVATE
dialogues.text: The French've been forced back on the western side, sir. Colonel Winnant looks at EXPLOSIONS over the warehouses.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: But they're still holding a perimeter?

dialogues.speaker: PRIVATE
dialogues.text: For now. Colonel Winnant pushes on down the mole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds Bolton, but NO SHIPS...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: Where're the destroyers?

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: There'll be one soon.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: One?

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: After yesterday's losses, it's one ship on the mole at a time.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: The battle's here, what're they saving them for?

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: The next battle. The one for Britain. Same with the planes.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: (peers through his field glasses) But it's right there! You can practically- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: Seeing home doesn't help us get there, Captain. Colonel Winnant turns to the flaming town at their backs.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: They need to send more ships, dammit! Every hour the enemy pushes closer

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: They've activated the small vessels pool-

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: Vessels pool?

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: The list of civilian boats for requisition-

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: Civilian? We need destroyers.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: Small boats could load from the beach. Colonel Winnant watches men struggling to load in the sur

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: Not in these conditions.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: I'd rather face waves than dive bombers. Colonel Winnant looks up at the cloudy sky-

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: You're right- they won't get up in this...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (points) The Royal Engineers are building piers from lorries- should help when the tide comes back.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: We'll know in six hours.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: I thought tides were every three? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: Then it's good that you're army and I'm navy, isn't it? Colonel Winnant allows himself a smile. Commander Bolton spots a shape on the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Vanquisher...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr.Dawson, at the helm, studies the horizon. Peter joins him, GLARING at the Shivering Soldier before taking a sea Mr.Dawson hears something, starts scanning the sky... Spots a distant plane... Peter follows his gaze... Mr.Dawson THROWS the wheel, bearing to starboard, hard, throttling up-

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: Heinkel. Mr.Dawson points at a MINESWEEPER heading towards them...

dialogues.speaker: MR.DAWSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They'll go for the minesweeper.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we stand by? To pick up survivors?

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: To do that we have to survive ourselves. As the boat MOTORS away, Peter looks back to see the HEIN AND ITS TWO FIGHTERS moving towards the MINESWEEPER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Highlanders approach, cautiously... the beach is DESE here- just disabled army vehicles and dead bodies... The blue trawler is tilted towards them... they circle th hull, checking it... it seems sound enough. Tommy and Gibson follow the Highlanders as they climb up onto the abandoned trawler...  42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy looks over at the dunes above them. Alex looks arou the boat- turns to Highlander1i

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Where's the crew?

dialogues.speaker: HIGHLANDER1
dialogues.text: Probably got spooked after they ran aground. Scarpered up the beach.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: HIGHLANDER2
dialogues.text: We're outside the perimeter. Enemy could be right there- Points at the dunes.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHLANDER2, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Best shut ourselves inside and wait for high tide... Highlander3 heads down the companionway into the small ho

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: How long's that?

dialogues.speaker: HIGHLANDER3
dialogues.text: Every three hours. They descend into the hold, shutting the door behind them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Moonstone ploughs through the swell, Peter looks back the Heinkel coming over the minesweeper... Peter SPOTS-

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Spitfires! Dad, Spitfires! Mr.Dawson TURNS to see two Spitfires DIVING at the German bomber and its fighter escort- One Spitfire DIVES RIGHT BETWEEN TWO 109'S SETTING ONE AL

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He got him, he got him!! The other Spitfire flies close over the Heinkel, which tu away from the ship- Mr.Dawson eases back on the speed... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: The Heinkel's moved off... As they watch, ONE OF THE SPITFIRES STARTS SMOKING...

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Oh, no. Mr.Dawson sees the smoke- THROWS the wheel, spinning the yacht around to head back-

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: Watch for a parachute! Mr.Dawson THROTTLES up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier hears his engine skip a beat- puts his gloved fin on the RESERVE TANK TOGGLE SWITCH, LISTENING... his engin evens out again. He puts his hand back on the stick, focu on the German planes... He THROTTLES UP, speeding into the fray, CLIMBING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dimly lit by a couple of small, dirty portholes. The soldiers lie around the hold. Sleeping or chatting. Alex is scrounging around the hold, finding nothing usefu

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (to Gibson) Poke your head out, see if the water's coming in. Gibson shakes his head, pulling his arms tight around him Alex GLARES at him-

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Talkative sod. Tommy gets up, climbs up to the door, cracks it- CRAWLS u into the well- PEEKS over the rail- The boat is in INCHES OF WATER.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Bugger. Barely come in at all.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: For fuck's sake. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HIGHLANDER3
dialogues.text: Calm down. What goes out comes back in, right?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah, but how long? Silence answers this. Clearly no sailors aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Moonstone PUSHES through the swell, FULL SPEED, diese engine STRAINING... Peter watches the SMOKE-TRAILING SPITFIRE fly LOWER and LOWER...

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: No parachute... Mr.Dawson is watching the plane like a hawk, steering aro the waves by instinct...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water FLASHES BY BLINDINGLY FAST... Collins PULLS BACK ON THE STICK, raising the nose as the plane-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter watches the Spitfire 'land' on the surface of the w

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: He's down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a SHOOOOOSH, the plane is floating over the swell- Like a sprinter hearing the gun- Collins RELEASES HIS BEL starts INFLATING his life vest- pulls the catch on the ca YANKING it back along its track- it JAMS... he THRUSTS hi hand through the gap, STRUGGLING... From outside it looks like he is WAVING... He looks up to see Farrier's spitfire shoot over, DIPPING WING IN SALUTE... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Collins sits in the gently bobbing plane, collecting hims as he watches the water start to rise around the slowly SINKING PLANE... Collins tries the canopy again- JAMMED. HE IS TRAPPED IN THE SINKING PLANE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier levels off, looking down at the Heinkel approachi It has a SINGLE FIGHTER ESCORT- an ME 109 off the port wi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy JOLTS awake- there are STEPS outside- he moves up t the door. Highlander1 gets his rifle, moves in front of t door. Aims. Nods at Tommy... Tommy throws open the door- a SEAMAN stands there-

dialogues.speaker: SEAMAN
dialogues.text: Nee, nee! Highlander1 is confused. Tommy GRABS the Seaman, PULLING him down into the hold. Highlander1 holds his gun on him-

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Kraut? The Seaman looks uncomprehendingly up at Alex-

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you German?!

dialogues.speaker: SEAMAN
dialogues.text: Dutch! Dutch! Merchant navy. Here to pick you up. To help you. They sit him up.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Why'd you leave your boat?

dialogues.speaker: SEAMAN
dialogues.text: In case Germans come. We wait up the beach with the soldiers. Wait for the tide. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HIGHLANDER2
dialogues.text: You came back, the tide must be in.

dialogues.speaker: SEAMAN
dialogues.text: Coming, yes. But more hours till we float.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hours?! Why'd you come back? The Seaman gestures around the packed hold-

dialogues.speaker: SEAMAN
dialogues.text: Not so heavy when I left! Alex and the others take this in. A GUNSHOT PENETRATES THE HULL- everybody LIES FLAT, Tommy STARES at the bullet hole, which lets in light...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr.Dawson PUSHES the boat towards where the plane went do

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: There was no ‘chute, dad... Mr.Dawson ignores him. The engine is SCREAMING...

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dad, there was no 'chute. He's probably dead-

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: (snaps) Damn it, he might be alive! Peter is SHOCKED at his dad's outburst. Mr.Dawson stares at where the plane went down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier lines up for his attack... sighting the Heinkel a it commits to its bombing run over the Destroyer- Farrier pushes forward on his stick, going into his DIVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody STARES at the bullet hole, not making a sound.. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Another SHOT PUNCHES A HOLE 2 FEET FROM THE FIRST- Highlanders near the holes ease away, SQUEEZING up agains other soldiers... BANG! A third shot, directly above the first... Two Highlanders GRAB their rifles, going for the stairs-

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: No! Then they'll know we're in here.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHLANDER1
dialogues.text: Why else are they shooting at us?!

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Look at the grouping... Everybody looks at the three bullet holes.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...target practice. BANG! A fourth hole, near the others...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Moonstone is getting closer to the Spitfire bobbing o the waves. Close enough to see that it is SINKING...

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: Peter, go forward with the boat hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins SMASHES the canopy back and forth on its track... JAMMED, JAMMED, JAMMED. WATER STARTS POURING IN, streaming through the gap in the half-open canopy... he SHUTS IT... TRAPPED... OPENS IT, YANKING, WATER POURING IN... Collins SEARCHES around looking for inspiration, for an implement, for ANYTHING- Water RISING past his ankles... his calves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier DIVES, plummeting towards the Heinkel... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He GLANCES across at the 109, which suddenly BANKS TOWARD HIM, clearly REACTING to Farrier's ATTACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the men STARE at the bullet holes, WATER starts SLOPPI through the lowest ones... a highlander goes to plug the holes- BANG! The highlander SCREAMS, clutching his face- his comrades pull him back, trying to SMOTHER his cries.. The water pours in STEADILY through the lowest holes. Ale points at the target zone-

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: We have to plug it!

dialogues.speaker: HIGHLANDER2
dialogues.text: After you, mate! They stay back from the holes, wary. Watching the WATER POUR IN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins pulls the steel FLARE GUN from its holder- Water is coming up OVER HIS LEGS NOW... He SMASHES the flare gun into the canopy, again and again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier FIRES at the Heinkel- TRACERS ZIPPING at the bomb The 109 RISES at him, GUNS BLAZING- Farrier ROLLS away, trying to dodge the fire-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Spitfire 1 rolls away, the Heinkel releases its load-

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST-
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Alex watches the water spraying in. He TURNS to the Dutch Seaman-

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: How do we get off?! Do we need to ditch some ballast?! The Dutch Seaman looks at him, uncomprehending-

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Weight! Do we need to lose weight! The Dutch Seaman shrugs-

dialogues.speaker: SEAMAN
dialogues.text: Weight, yes. Alex turns to face the group-

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Somebody needs to get off.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHLANDER1
dialogues.text: Well volunteered.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: We don't need a volunteer. I know someone who ought to get off... Alex turns to Tommy and Gibson. Points at Gibson.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This one. He's a German spy.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Don't be daft. Alex stares Gibson down...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: He's a bloody jerry. You might not've noticed that he hasn't said a word, but I have. He doesn't speak English- or if he does it's with an accent thicker than sauerkraut sauce-

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: You're daft. Tell him. Gibson just stares at Alex...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah, tell me. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just the sound of water SPRAYING IN HARD- jettin in through the bottom holes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins SMACKS the canopy- The flare gun BOUNCES OFF- He DROPS the flare gun- SCRAMBLES to find it under the water- The water is RISING UP HIS CHEST...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier CUTS RIGHT, dodging away from the 109- BANKING HARD, he gets a clear look at the Destroyer weath the EXPLOSIONS- A PLUME OF WATER RIGHT NEXT TO THE DESTROYER comes so hig he flies through the top of its spray-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex TURNS to Highlander 1- holds out his hand for his gu Highlander 1 hands it over- Alex moves at Gibson pointing the rifle, he hooks the bar on Gibson's tags, pulling them closer to read-

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Tell me..., Gibson! Tommy looks at Gibson, panicking-

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Tell him, for God's sake! Alex PUSHES the rifle against Gibson's CHEEK- Gibson CRAC

dialogues.speaker: FRANCAIS
dialogues.text: Tommy stares, SHOCKED. Alex moves back slightly, taking this in... A BURST OF MACHINE GUN FIRE- everyone DUCKS from ricochet (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: A Frog. A bloody Frog. A cowardly little queue-jumping frog... With the end of his rifle Alex shakes Gibson's tags-

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who's Gibson, eh? A naked dead Englishman lying out on that sand. Or did you at least have the decency to bury him? 'Gibson' just stares.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: He did. I helped him- I thought it was his mate.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Maybe he killed him-

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: He didn't kill him-

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: How do we know?!

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: How hard is it to find a dead Englishman on Dunkirk beach, for God's sake?! He didn't kill anyone- he was looking for a way off the damned sand like the rest of us! The water is SPRAYING IN FROM MORE AND MORE HOLES as the WATER LEVEL RISES... Alex has the rifle on Gibson. Another BURST OF MACHINE GU

dialogues.speaker: HIGHLANDER2
dialogues.text: Haven't they had enough practice by now?! !!

dialogues.speaker: HIGHLANDER1
dialogues.text: They're making sure she won't float. Highlander2 looks at the holes SPRAYING WATER, the water POOLING in the bottom of the hold- he turns to the Seaman

dialogues.speaker: HIGHLANDER2
dialogues.text: Will she still float?! The Seaman assesses the leaks... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SEAMAN
dialogues.text: Float, yes. With less weight, yes-

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: And we know who's getting off-

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: You can't do that. We're on the same side. Alex NUDGES Gibson with the rifle-

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Go on- up you go-

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: As soon as he pokes his head out they'll slaughter him-

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Better him than me-

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: It's not fair-

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Survival's not fair.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHLANDER1
dialogues.text: No, it's shit. It's fear and greed. Fate squeezed through the bowels of men. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: He saved our lives.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHLANDER2
dialogues.text: And he's about to do it again- go on- Alex starts shoving Gibson up the stairs-

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: No! Just stop! Alex turns to Tommy- looks him in the eye-

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: We need someone to get off so the rest of us can live- you want to volunteer?

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Fuck no. I'm going home.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: And if this is the price? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: I'll live with it, but it's wrong. Alex shoves Gibson up another step, opens the door-

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alex, one man's not going to make enough difference-

dialogues.speaker: HIGHLANDER1
dialogues.text: You'd best hope it does- 'cos you'd be volunteering next-

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (indicates Highlanders) We're regimental brothers, mate. Just the way it is. Gibson GRABS for the rifle- Tommy JUMPS at Alex to help G they SMASH against the hull- as they drop into the water, the ship LEVELS-

dialogues.speaker: START THE BLOODY ENGINE-
dialogues.text: The Seaman is already crawling out the hatch, reaching up The ENGINE STARTS- LOUD as LOUD can be-

dialogues.speaker: WATERLINE...
dialogues.text: The Seaman THROWS the screw into reverse, FULL THROTTLE.. The men HOLD THEIR BREATHS UNDER THE WATER AT THE BOTTOM THE HOLD AS BULLETS PEPPER THE HULL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins, WATER UP TO HIS EARS NOW, grabs the flare gun-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now he PANICS, pushing his face up against the canopy, BA

dialogues.speaker: SMASH- SOMETHING CRACKS INTO THE CANOPY RIGHT ABOVE HIS H
dialogues.text: he RECOILS- it IMPACTS the canopy again- SMASHING A HOLE- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It is a BOAT HOOK... Collins PULLS HIMSELF THROUGH THE HOLE- ELBOWS FIRST- FOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins BREAKS the surface, GASPING, looks around- A private yacht with a young man on the bow, boat hook extended... Collins GRASPS the boat hook.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: (breathless) Afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier comes around again, searching the sky for the Ger planes... He looks down at the Destroyer- It is LEAKING OIL FROM A LARGE HOLE IN ITS SIDE... The dark OIL SLICK SPREADS QUICKLY ACROSS THE WATER- COVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Destroyer BASILISK casts off. Men cover every availab piece of deck. Commander Bolton watches her wake. Colonel Winnant approa

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: We've wasted the day, Commander.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: I share your frustration, Colonel. They hear distant SHOTS- Commander Bolton raises his FIELD GLASSES... he sees a bl trawler stuck in the shallows miles down the beach.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Grounded trawler, taking fire. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Colonel Winnant takes the field glasses...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: The enemy's breaking through the dunes to the east. This is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy comes up for air, GASPING, SPLUTTERING... Water is POURING IN FROM DOZENS AND DOZENS OF HOLES... Alex comes up, COUGHING, with Gibson...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: We're off-! Alex crawls over to the stairs, climbs out into the well-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex pokes his head out as the Seaman is sneaking up to s where they are headed- The Dutch Seaman TURNS the wheel- JUMPS back onto the flo of the well as BULLETS IMPACT the cabin- He throws the engine into FORWARD gear- Turns to Alex-

dialogues.speaker: THE HOLES
dialogues.text: Alex crawls back downstairs-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex FALLS down the stairs-

dialogues.speaker: PLUG THE HOLES
dialogues.text: The men STUFF RAGS, BOLTS, FINGERS, ANYTHING they can lay hands on to plug as many holes as possible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins, drying himself with a blanket, looks down at Geo whose breathing is shallow, sightless eyes open. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: (to Peter) I don't really know, son. You were right not to move him. (reassuring) You've done the best for him you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shivering Soldier watches Collins come out on deck-

dialogues.speaker: SHIVERING SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Is he alright?

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No. Peter is glaring at the Shivering Soldier

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, he's not- BOOM! Collins follows Mr.Dawson's gaze to a Destroyer up ahead being BOMBED by a Heinkel, HUGE PLUMES of water ris just beside her... The Shivering Soldier retreats into himself- Peter runs u to the bow- A BLUE FISHING TRAWLER a quarter of a mile off, sinking..

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dad, there's men in the water Mr.Dawson looks ahead to where Peter is pointing- He puts the throttle forward, heading into the fray... Collins spots Spitfire 1 arcing around, trying to get a b on the Heinkel...

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Come on, Farrier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier pulls on the stick, lining up behind a 109... He FIRES, chasing down the plane, FIRING again... SMOKE f the German plane, which starts to drop... Farrier is in a heavy DIVE, when HIS ENGINE CHOKES- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Farrier's hand DARTS forward, SWITCHING TO HIS RESERVE TA BEFORE THE ENGINE CAN DIE... The engine CATCHES AGAIN- Farrier PULLS OUT OF THE DIVE..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
