dialogues.text: Through the binoculars Colonel Winnant watches the Blue Trawler pushing out to sea, LOW in the water... Commander Bolton watches a Destroyer, under full steam, heading out to the channel... Where there are SHAPES OF BOATS ON THE HORIZON...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dutch Seaman aims the boat at a Destroyer out at the mouth of the harbour...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy, Gibson, Alex, Highlander1 and the others STUFF the holes as best they can- the makeshift plugs POP OUT every few seconds- the soldiers SCRABBLE UNDER WATER to find th and STUFF them back in- hands PRESSED against water jets SPRAY COMING IN EVERYWHERE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dutch Seaman looks over the rail, CONCERNED, to see h fast his boat is lowering into the swell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins watches Farrier spin around to get after the Hein The Moonstone comes up on the men in the water. Collins comes to the side, to help Peter fish men out- Collins notices the surface of the water-

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: (to Mr.Dawson) Oil. We're getting into oil! Mr.Dawson puts the screw into reverse, stopping the boat. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They fish men out of the water- the men COVERED IN OIL ANONYMOUS IN THEIR GLOSSY BLACK FILTH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier chases down the Heinkel, closing in as its top tu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dutch Seaman sees water SLOSHING OVER THE DECK-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers, holding back the water, cannot hear him... by one they start to abandon the task- more and more wate pouring in... Alex and Gibson are last- Alex TURNS, sees they are alone, GRABS Gibson by the shoulder then JUMPS f the exit- Gibson, STILL HOLDING BACK THE WATER, notices too late-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy gets on deck- Sees the Keith, a quarter of a mile away... He DIVES INTO THE WATER, pulling away from the SWAMPED TR All the men dive off the sinking boat, swimming for the Keith...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibson DIVES for the exit- He is BLASTED back by water- DRAGGED DOWN with the sinking trawler...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, Collins and the first oil-covered men pull more oi men from the water, the decks of the yacht rapidly fillin Mr.Dawson looks at the oil slick, concerned. He addresses the oily survivors-

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: Below deck.

dialogues.speaker: OILY SURVIVOR
dialogues.text: No fear.

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: We need to get as many of you on board as we can before the oil catches fire- get below or get off my boat- your choice. The oily survivors head below decks- Peter runs back to t companionway to shout down-

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Careful there-!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter pokes his head down- Sees two oily survivors moving George from the bottom of steps-

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Careful! The oily survivors look up at him- Alex is one of them-

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (quiet) He's dead, mate. Peter takes this in...

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: So be bloody careful with him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Bolton STARES at the shapes in the distance... He GRABS the field glasses from Colonel Winnant, puts the to his eyes- BOATS. CIVILIAN BOATS. ALL SHAPES AND SIZES. AN ARMADA. Colonel Winnant PEERS over Commander Bolton's shoulder... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: What can you see? Commander Bolton slowly lowers the glasses.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: (gentle) Home . Colonel Winnant grabs the glasses, confused...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOLDIERS peer over the railing at the absurd collecti of vessels passing them in the opposite direction:

dialogues.speaker: FERRIES, DREDGERS, DINGHIES, ROW BOATS...
dialogues.text: Crewed by:

dialogues.speaker: CREW, NAVAL CREW, NURSES, RETIRED SAILORS...
dialogues.text: The EXHAUSTED SOLDIERS lining the decks of the Basilisk s to CLAP...then to CHEER... some are CRYING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter steps out of the cabin, REELING. Meets his dad's questioning glance with unmistakable shock-

dialogues.speaker: SHIVERING SOLDIER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The lad... Peter turns. The Shivering Soldier is looking up at him with terrified eyes, blanket TIGHT around his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: SHIVERING SOLDIER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Will he be okay? Peter looks at the Shivering Soldier. Sees the WHITE KNUC clasping the edge of the rough blanket. Peter NODS. The Shivering Soldier turns, staring out at the destroyer Peter catches Mr.Dawson looking at him. Approving. Collins, pulling a man from the water, looks up at Spitfi 1 chasing down the Heinkel-

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Come on, Farrier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier strafes the Heinkel- no apparent effect- Zipping over it, he dives down out of range of its turret BANKS hard left to line up for another shot- A 109 CUTS across him- TRACER FIRE SHOOTING PAST-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy SWIMS for the Keith... He hears an airplane... looks up to see a Heinkel coming over the Keith... the BOMBS DROP- PLUMES OF WATER SHOOT UPWARDS ALL AROUND THE SHIP- Tommy DIVES under the water for protection- the EXPLOSIONS ARE

dialogues.speaker: DEAFENING- HE HOLDS HIS EARS WITH HIS HANDS-
dialogues.text: Tommy BREAKS the surface- the barrage is over- the Keith still afloat- Tommy swims for it- Getting closer, Tommy realizes he's swimming in OIL, the black sludge covering his head and arms- he looks back- t blue trawler is gently slipping beneath the water... Tommy makes for the Keith, even as he sees men JUMPING in the water from her decks... LIFEBOATS being lowered... Tommy SPOTS another craft- a YACHT HEADING TOWARDS THEM- Tommy PULLS for the yacht as hard as he can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rag tag collection of SMALL SHIPS works the beach, pi men up in the shallows, ferrying them out to bigger ships Small open boats use the truck 'pier' to load men as the Engineer looks on with pride...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Moonstone is FILLED with oil-covered men- throughout hold and across the decks- MANY MORE still in the water... the Keith LISTS, men jump off the far side, away from the oil slick, where small sh are gathering to pick them up... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Collins moves up the side- watching Farrier bank hard to behind the Heinkel- a 109 ZIPS across his path, guns blazing... Collins looks down at the oil-covered water...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier pulls around, HARD- the Heinkel is in front of hi side on, heading in for another run at Keith- Farrier banks and pulls up to keep the bomber in his sigh as he FIRES his cannons- The HEINKEL CATCHES FIRE and starts FALLING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins sees the Heinkel CATCH FIRE- TURNS to Mr.Dawson-

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Mr.Dawson THROWS the engine into gear, TURNS the wheel- The Heinkel FALLS FLAMING TOWARDS THE OIL SLICK... Peter has hold of one last oil-covered survivor, who hang on for dear life as the boat DRAGS HIM THROUGH THE OILY W The men left in the water shout with despair as the Moons motors away- The FLAMING HEINKEL HITS THE WATER- EXPLODES-

dialogues.speaker: ESCAPE THE FLAMES-
dialogues.text: UNDERWATER: HIGHLANDER1 pushes down under, LOOKING UP AT FIRE... the SURFACE IS AFLAME AS FAR AS HE CAN SEE... Peter HOLDS on to the oil-covered soldier- Who is now being washed with cleaner water as they COME o of the slick- As the oil comes off his face we see that IT IS TOMMY... Collins watches, appalled, as the men in the water are engulfed by RELENTLESS FLAMES... the Keith is going down- survivors on the far side are picked up by the various SM SHIPS... Under the water, HIGHLANDER1'S AIR RUNS OUT- the FLAMES R ABOVE... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HE IS ENGULFED, SCREAMING, DYING-
dialogues.text: Tommy lies on the deck at Peter's feet, eyes closed...

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: (a whisper) Take me home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier sees the Heinkel EXPLODE, turns away towards the beaches... He looks down at- The thousands of men on the beach The small ships ferrying out to the larger vessels The narrow mole with its endless rope of men... Farrier is awestruck... He hears his engine start to SPUTTER... It dies and the prop STOPS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Bolton watches with satisfaction as a PADDLE ST ties up... he calls up to a STEWARDESS(59)-

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: Where're you from?

dialogues.speaker: STEWARDESS
dialogues.text: Out of Dartmouth! Bolton shakes his head in joyous disbelief. He watches me load into a SMALL OPEN SAILBOAT crewed by two YOUNG MEN-

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: From Deal? (they nod) Mind the current at the mouth, boys. Bolton spots Spitfire 1- it SOARS overhead. He waves-

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Where've you been all my life?! Commander Bolton SIGHS at this... then notices. No engine noise. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He watches the spitfire, concerned, until- Hears something BEHIND... another engine... a high whine. he turns to see- A STUKA... The men lining the mole shift restlessly. TRAPPED...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Moonstone chugs along, low in the water, men laying d along her decks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men lie on every available space, packed in like sardines Tommy catches sight of Alex looking at him. Tommy nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr.Dawson is at the helm. Collins hears a distant engine-

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: That's a fighter-

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: ME 109, from the South. Peter, take the wheel, listen for my instructions. Mr.Dawson steps up onto the seat to look above the roof o the cabin...

dialogues.speaker: MR.DAWSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Point her south. Peter turns the wheel, the Moonstone swings to port, straightens up. Mr.Dawson SPOTS THE 109, CLOSING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Bolton turns to see the STUKA approaching, its distinctive kinked-wing silhouette bearing down like an A BIRD OF PREY... The soldiers stir, some crouching, some closing their eye Commander Bolton takes a knee, BRACING. He bites his lip the STUKA goes into its dive, that TERRIBLE WHINE BUILDIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr.Dawson STARES at the approaching 109-

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: Full speed ahead. Peter throttles up- The 109 is GROWING- CLOSE NOW...

dialogues.speaker: MR.DAWSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get ready to pull hard to port... before he fires he'll have to lower his nose, I'll give you the signal... Peter reaches over to the side of the wheel, ready to thr it- the 109 is practically upon them..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Bolton is mumbling a prayer as he watches the S come at them-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier darts past the STUKA, GLIDING, GUNS BLAZING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STUKA never fires, it just SMASHES into the sea... The soldiers all along the Mole CHEER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier watches the STUKA disintegrate on the surface of water. He nods... feeling the UNACCUSTOMED SILENCE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr.Dawson STARES at the approaching 109- Peter glances ba and forth between the 109 and his father...

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: Wait for it... wait till he's committed to his line... The nose of the 109 DIPS DOWN- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NOW
dialogues.text: Peter THROWS THE WHEEL, the Moonstone LURCHES TO PORT- The GUNS ON THE 109 LIGHT UP, STRAFING THE WATER TO STARB The 109 FLASHES OVER... Collins watches it recede.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: He's off.

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: Bigger fish to fry. Collins looks at Mr.Dawson. Curious.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: How'd you know all that, anyway? Mr.Dawson steps onto the deck.

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: My son's one of you lot. I knew he'd see us through. Mr.Dawson moves forward. Collins steps up beside Peter.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: You're RAF?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Not me. My brother. Flew Hurricanes. He died third week into the war. Collins looks forward at the proud father standing by the mast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier sits in the silence, GLIDING... looking to see ho far he might make it up the beach...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy gets to his feet, steps over other men as he slips over to the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy and Alex poke their heads out- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Stay below, please.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: We just want to see the cliffs- Tommy looks over at WHITE CLIFFS, ghostly above the dark water.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dover? Peter shakes his head, amused.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Weymouth. Alex shakes his head, sadly.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: We let you all down, didn't we? Peter just looks at this exhausted, ragged boy his own ag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier GLIDES, banking, looking for a suitable stretch o beach to ditch... In the strangely SILENT plane, he passes over the troops lines up on the vast stretch of sand beyond Malo les Bain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldier after soldier climbs out of the yacht. The CORPOR handing out travel chits marvels at the absurd amount...

dialogues.speaker: CORPORAL
dialogues.text: How many you got in there? The Shivering Soldier is taken ashore, wrapped in blanket Tommy and Alex stick together as they are handed hot cups tea and shepherded out of the harbour in long lines. Peter supervises as George's body is taken ashore. As Collins steps off the boat a soldier from another boat spots his RAF uniform-

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: (furious) Where the hell were you! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Collins just stands there. He feels a hand on his shoulde It is Mr.Dawson. He indicates the men filing off the Moonstone-

dialogues.speaker: MR. DAWSON
dialogues.text: They know where you were. Mr.Dawson puts his hat on. To go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy and Alex, exhausted, downcast, are herded across th tracks towards a train. Before getting on they are handed BLANKET and cup of tea by an ELDERLY MAN, who looks at th hands not their faces as he hands the rough blanket over-

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY MAN
dialogues.text: ...well done, lads... well done lads...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: All we did is survive.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY MAN
dialogues.text: That's enough. Well, done, lads well done, lads... Alex steps up onto the train. The Elderly Man reaches out to Tommy, touching his face- clearly BLIND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy FLOPS down, lying across the seat. Alex is slumped opposite, tears starting to roll down his cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That old bloke wouldn't even look us in the eye. No response. He looks over- Tommy is already asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mole is EMPTY but for bodies. A PRIVATE opens his eyes. He sits up, alone on the desert Mole, his comrades gone, mistaken for dead...

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Come on, then, private... The Private looks down at the water to see Commander Bolt standing in a launch full of ARMY OFFICERS. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know we're officers, but it's us or the enemy, so now's not the time to be particular... The Private scrambles down into the launch, where Colonel Winnant stands talking to Commander Bolton. They look out at the vast deserted beach, littered with corpses and abandoned equipment...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: (to Commander Bolton) Churchill got his 30 thousand.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: And then some. Almost three hundred thousand. So far. Commander Bolton steps back up onto the mole.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WINNANT
dialogues.text: So far?

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER BOLTON
dialogues.text: I'm staying. (off look) For the French. The Launch pulls away from Commander Bolton on the mole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight FLICKERING on Tommy's eyelids wakes him. We have the sense that he has been asleep for a very long time. The train full of soldiers rolls to a halt. Alex opens th window- spots a BOY near the tracks-

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hey! Where are we?!

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Siding. You'll pull in in a minute-

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What station?

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: (surprised) Woking. Alex spots stacks of NEWSPAPERS waiting to be loaded. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Grab me one of them papers. (the boy hesitates) Go on! The boy pulls the paper off the top and stretches up to h it to Alex. Alex slumps into his seat, the headline:

dialogues.speaker: "CHURCHILL ADDRESSES DUNKIRK EVACUATION IN COMMONS"
dialogues.text: Alex thrusts the paper at Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can't bear it. You read it.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Can't bear it?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: They'll be spitting at us in the streets. If they're not locked up waiting for the invasion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter walks down the DESERTED HIGH STREET. He stops. Walk into the office of the local paper- the Herald...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter hands the EDITOR a photograph. Of George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier CHECKS his CANOPY is locked... STOWS loose items. PUMPING the handle all the while...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The landing gear INCHES out of its housing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy looks down at the paper. Starts to read. Poorly.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: "Wars are not won by evacuations." Alex shakes his head at this. The train starts to pull into the station... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The platform is CROWDED WITH CIVILIANS- Alex SLINKS DOWN into his seat, turning away from the window... A CIVILIAN BANGS on the glass, PEERING in...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I can't look.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: "But there was a victory inside this deliverance which should be noted..." Alex turns- the Civilian GRINS, holding up two beer bottl The platform is packed with CHEERING AND WAVING CIVILIANS Women with SANDWICHES and DRINKS rush up to the windows..

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "Our thankfulness at the escape of our army..." Alex opens the window, GRABBING food and drink as Tommy continues to read...

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "Must not blind us to the fact that what has happened in France... Isa colossal military disaster..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier PUMPS the handle-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The landing gear INCHES past HALFWAY DOWN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUMPING the handle, Farrier checks his belts-

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ",,.,and we must expect another blow to be struck almost immediately..." He holds the plane steady in its descent towards the sand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spitfire 1 SWOOPS onto the flat sand, WHEELS DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: "We shall go on to the end, we shall fight in France..," Farrier SLIDES back the canopy and climbs out of the plan  72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, gets up from the kitchen table. MRS.DAWSON is at t stove, her back to us. As Peter grabs his coat he runs into Mr.Dawson, letters i hand, looking at the Herald. He hands it to Peter...

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: "We shall fight on the seas and oceans..," The small headline:

dialogues.speaker: "LOCAL BOY, GEORGE MILLS, JUST 17, HERO AT DUNKIRK"
dialogues.text: Peter looks at his father. Nods with satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier brushes sand from the wing of his beloved Spitfir

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ",..We shall fight with growing confidence and growing strength in the air..." Farrier pulls his FLARE GUN... he SHOOTS INTO THE COCKPIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex hangs out the window, GUZZLING from a beer bottle, GRINNING at the women outside...

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: "We shall defend our Island-" Alex turns, deliriously HAPPY, beer running down his chin

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: (louder, over the celebration) ",,.we shall defend our island, whatever the cost may be- we shall fight on the beaches, we shall fight on the landing grounds..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bodies gently bob in the water...

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: "We shall fight in the fields and the streets..." (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Abandoned trucks and anti-aircraft guns, piles of boots, stacks of rifles catch the last light...

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: "We shall fight in the hills; we shall never surrender..." Bodies line the length of the mole...

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: "And even if, which I do not fora moment believe, this island... were subjugated and starving..,"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrier KNEELS, HANDS ON HEAD, as DARK SHAPES OF GERMAN SOLDIERS (seen only from behind) surround him...

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ",,.then our empire beyond the seas, armed and guarded by the British fleet, would carry on the struggle..." Farrier is led away from the BURNING PLANE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is oblivious. Tommy continues, to himself...

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: ",,,until, in God's good time..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving towards the BURNING SPITFIRE...

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ",,..the New World, with all its power and might..," 73. 195 196 197 198 The shape of the plane is still visible beneath the FLAME

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ",,.steps forth to the rescue and the liberation of the old." MOVE IN on the burning spitfire until the FLAMES FILL THE FRAME and we- CUT TO BLACK. CREDITS. END.
